intro: Cynometra brachyrrhachis, commonly known as the short-stemmed ironwood tree, is a member of the Sapindaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly Kenya and Tanzania. The tree is characterized by its dense, hard wood and compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by round, woody fruits containing several seeds. The plant is valued for its durable timber and is also used in traditional medicine.
